title: Academic Research Data Visualization Dashboard Designer
description: Upload your raw research datasets and define research goals to receive an initial multi-chart dashboard wireframe proposal with chart type recommendations and interaction design ideas tailored for academic research data analysis and communication.
inputLabel: Upload dataset file (CSV, XLSX, JSON) and enter research goals
systemPrompt: You are an academic research dashboard design assistant. You will analyze an uploaded dataset file and the user's research questions, target audience, and optional preferred chart types to generate a structured multi-chart dashboard layout plan, chart visualization specs, interaction design outline, and narrative annotation suggestions. Only accept input files in CSV, XLSX, or JSON format under size limits. Validate and refuse unsupported or corrupt files with clear error messages. Ensure outputs are clear, publication-quality dashboard proposals focused on clarity and academic communication. Do not provide advanced statistical analysis or replace domain expert interpretation. Refuse requests that involve unsupported file formats, personal data exposure, or non-academic use. Output must be plain text summarizing the dashboard proposal, optionally formatted as JSON if requested. Enforce strict data privacy and user ownership rules.

presets.label: High-level Proposal
presets.prompt: Analyze the uploaded dataset and research goals to produce an initial multi-chart dashboard wireframe with chart type recommendations and interaction design ideas. Focus on clarity and academic audience communication.

presets.label: Detailed Chart Specs
presets.prompt: Provide detailed chart specifications and data mappings for each recommended chart in the dashboard proposal, including visualization styles and interaction details.

presets.label: Narrative Annotation Suggestions
presets.prompt: Suggest narrative annotations and key insight highlights for the proposed dashboard to support data storytelling tailored to the target audience.

presets.label: Interaction Design Outline
presets.prompt: Outline user interaction designs such as filtering, drill-downs, and linked views for the proposed dashboard to enhance exploratory analysis.

jsonSchemaHint: If structured output is enabled, output JSON must include keys: layoutPlan (object), chartSpecifications (array), interactionDesign (object), annotations (array).
clarifyPrompt: Please provide the research questions or hypotheses, target audience description, and optionally preferred chart types or draft figures. Upload your dataset file in CSV, XLSX, or JSON format. Maximum file size is 10MB.
finalizePrompt: Review the generated dashboard wireframe proposal. If you want to customize chart configurations, filters, or annotations, please proceed to the dashboard editor. You can also export the dashboard to supported visualization platforms.

idea.workingTitle: Academic Research Data Visualization Dashboard Designer

niche.scenario: Designing interactive multi-chart dashboards for complex research datasets to explore and communicate findings

idea.problem: Academic researchers often struggle to create effective, interactive, and publication-quality multi-chart dashboards that integrate diverse data types and support exploratory data analysis and stakeholder communication. Existing tools focus on static visualizations or single-chart outputs without guiding layout, interactivity design, or narrative flow tailored for academic workflows.
inputs: Raw research dataset files (CSV, Excel, JSON)
Target audience description (e.g., peer reviewers, funding agencies, general public)
Preferred chart types or visualization styles (optional)
Existing draft figures or visual assets (optional)
outputs: Structured dashboard layout plan with multiple coordinated interactive charts
Chart-specific visualization specifications and data mappings
User interaction design outline (filtering, drill-downs, linked views)
Narrative annotation suggestions for key insights and data storytelling
Exportable dashboard prototype files or code snippets (e.g., for Tableau, Power BI, or web frameworks)
whyItWins: Addresses the unmet need for guided, integrated multi-chart dashboard design specialized for academic research data
Facilitates iterative refinement from raw data and research goals to polished, interactive visual storytelling
Supports diverse data types and audience tailoring, enhancing communication impact
Lowers the barrier for researchers without advanced data viz skills to produce publication- and presentation-ready dashboards
Has clear paths to integrate with existing data analysis pipelines and visualization platforms

upgradePath.today: Provide a single-page tool that analyzes uploaded datasets and research goals to propose an initial multi-chart dashboard wireframe with chart type recommendations and interaction ideas.
upgradePath.in90Days: Expand to a multi-page app enabling users to customize chart configurations, data filters, and annotation text, preview interactive dashboard mockups, and export specification reports.
upgradePath.in12Months: Develop a full dashboard authoring system with live data integration, drag-and-drop layout editing, export to popular visualization platforms, collaboration features, and audience engagement analytics to support iterative research communication.

riskNotes: Must ensure data privacy and secure handling of potentially sensitive research datasets
Avoid producing overly complex visualizations that could confuse rather than clarify findings
Require clear disclaimers that tool assists design but does not replace domain expert data interpretation
Need to keep interface intuitive to not overwhelm researchers new to dashboarding

blueprint.summary: An academic research dashboard designer that guides researchers from raw data and research questions to interactive multi-chart dashboard prototypes, supporting customization, narrative annotation, and export to visualization platforms.
successMetrics: Number of dashboards successfully created and exported
User satisfaction and perceived ease of use among researchers
Reduction in time from raw data upload to dashboard prototype
Diversity of data types and chart styles supported
Adoption rate of export features to popular visualization tools

edgeCases: Uploaded datasets with inconsistent or missing data fields
Research questions or audience descriptions that are vague or conflicting
Users uploading unsupported file formats or corrupted files
Export failures due to unsupported chart types or platform limitations
Simultaneous edits causing dashboard version conflicts
Handling very large datasets that exceed processing limits
nonGoals: Performing advanced statistical analysis or data cleaning beyond basic schema extraction
Replacing domain expert interpretation of research data
Providing a full-featured visualization platform or runtime environment
Supporting non-academic or commercial dashboard use cases
Implementing real-time live data streaming or collaboration in initial phases

dataFlow: User authenticates and accesses /upload page to submit dataset files and research goals.
UI-upload component sends multipart/form-data POST to /api/uploadDataset with file and metadata.
On successful upload, background job DataSchemaExtraction triggers to extract data schema and validate dataset.
User submits research goals via /api/saveResearchGoal linked to the uploaded dataset.
User navigates to /dashboard-proposal page, which fetches dashboard proposal by POSTing datasetId and researchGoalId to /api/analyze.
API-analysis processes dataset schema and research goals to generate initial dashboard wireframe proposals with chart and interaction recommendations.
User proceeds to /dashboard-editor page, loading dashboardDesignId to fetch and display current dashboard design.
UI-dashboardDesigner allows customization of charts, filters, annotations, and previews interactive mockups.
On save, UI-dashboardDesigner POSTs updated dashboardDesign JSON to /api/saveDashboard to persist changes and versioning.
User navigates to /export page, selects export format, and POSTs dashboardDesignId and format to /api/export.
API-export triggers ExportFileGeneration background job to asynchronously generate export files or code snippets.
Export status and downloadable links are provided to user upon completion.
DashboardVersionCleanup background job runs periodically to archive or delete old dashboard versions per retention policies.
validationRules: Dataset upload: accept only supported file formats (e.g., CSV, XLSX, JSON), max file size limit enforced.
Dataset upload: validate file integrity and parseability before accepting.
Research goals: researchQuestions and targetAudience must be non-empty strings with reasonable length limits.
Preferred chart types and draft figures metadata must conform to predefined JSON schema if provided.
API-analyze: datasetId and researchGoalId must exist and belong to authenticated user.
Dashboard design JSON must conform to schema including layoutPlan, chartSpecifications, interactionDesign, and version number.
Export format must be one of supported platforms (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Web).
Undo/redo operations in UI-dashboardDesigner must maintain consistent dashboard state.
Version conflicts on dashboard save must be detected and resolved (e.g., via optimistic locking).
errorHandling: Upload errors: return descriptive messages for unsupported formats, file size exceeded, or parse failures.
Authentication failures: return 401 Unauthorized with clear instructions to login.
Authorization errors: 403 Forbidden if user tries to access or modify data not owned by them.
API-analysis errors: handle missing or inconsistent data gracefully, return 400 with validation details.
Dashboard save conflicts: return 409 Conflict with version mismatch details and instructions to reload.
Export failures: return 500 with clear error messages indicating unsupported chart types or platform limitations.
Background job failures: log errors, notify users via UI status updates or notifications.
Network or server errors: return 500 with generic error message and retry options.
securityNotes: All API routes require user authentication and verify ownership of dataset, research goals, and dashboard designs.
Dataset files are stored encrypted at rest with access controls limiting to owning user.
File uploads sanitized to prevent injection or malware; scan files if possible.
Sensitive metadata and user inputs validated and sanitized to prevent XSS or injection attacks.
Use HTTPS for all data transmissions.
Implement rate limiting on upload and API endpoints to prevent abuse.
Background jobs run with least privilege and secure access to storage.
Retention policies ensure data is deleted or archived per privacy requirements.

acceptanceTests.given: An authenticated user on /upload page with a valid CSV dataset and research goals
acceptanceTests.when: User uploads dataset and submits research goals
acceptanceTests.then: System stores dataset and goals, triggers schema extraction, and returns upload confirmation with parsing feedback

acceptanceTests.given: An authenticated user with uploaded dataset and saved research goals
acceptanceTests.when: User navigates to /dashboard-proposal and requests analysis
acceptanceTests.then: System returns dashboard wireframe proposal with chart recommendations and interaction ideas

acceptanceTests.given: An authenticated user on /dashboard-editor with a dashboardDesignId
acceptanceTests.when: User customizes charts, annotations, and saves dashboard design
acceptanceTests.then: System persists updated dashboard design with incremented version and allows undo/redo

acceptanceTests.given: An authenticated user on /export page with a valid dashboardDesignId
acceptanceTests.when: User selects export format and initiates export
acceptanceTests.then: System triggers export job, eventually provides export file URL and status to user

acceptanceTests.given: A user attempts to upload unsupported file format or oversized file
acceptanceTests.then: System rejects upload with clear error message indicating the issue

acceptanceTests.given: Two users attempt simultaneous edits on the same dashboard design version
acceptanceTests.when: Second user tries to save outdated version
acceptanceTests.then: System returns conflict error and prompts user to reload latest dashboard design

acceptanceTests.given: A user tries to access dashboard design or dataset not owned by them
acceptanceTests.when: User requests data via API or UI

Develop /dashboard-proposal page UI to display dashboard wireframe and recommendations
Create API route /api/saveDashboard to save and version dashboard designs with conflict detection
Develop /dashboard-editor page UI for dashboard customization, undo/redo, and preview
Create API route /api/export to initiate export jobs and return export status and URLs
Implement background job ExportFileGeneration for asynchronous export file creation
Develop /export page UI to select export formats and display export results

Perform acceptance testing and edge case handling

prismaModelsToAdd: model Dataset { id String @id userId String filename String fileType String uploadDate DateTime dataSchema Json? encryptedDataLocation String @@index([userId]) @@index([uploadDate]) }
model ResearchGoal { id String @id datasetId String researchQuestions String targetAudience String preferredChartTypes Json? draftFiguresMetadata Json? lastUpdated DateTime @@index([datasetId]) }

model DashboardDesign { id String @id datasetId String layoutPlan Json chartSpecifications Json interactionDesign Json annotations Json? version Int exportHistory Json? lastModified DateTime @@index([datasetId]) @@index([version]) }
